A.name: Offenses Against Persons
examples: Discrimination based on race, gender, religion, or sexual orientation

B.name: Offenses Against Integrity
examples: Falsification of academic records or documents
Providing false information to University officials

C.name: Offenses Against Property
examples: Disobeying school regulations on care of University environment
Stealing or unauthorized possession of others' property
Selling, disposing of, or tampering with stolen property
Vandalism or defacement of school, personal, or public property
Engaging in activities resulting in damage to school property

D.name: Offenses Against Order
examples: Failure to perform responsibilities as students
Failure to wear appropriate attire for university setting
Disturbing or disrupting a class or school function
Violating rules of Residence Halls or Rizal Library
Failure to comply with official summonses

E.name: Offenses Involving Dishonesty
examples: Fabrication of data, citations, or results
Unauthorized use of AI for academic exercises
Forging or tampering with academic records

cheating: Any form of unauthorized communication during exams
Making one's paper visible to others
Possession of unauthorized notes or materials during exams
academic_dishonesty.plagiarism: Using others' work without proper attribution
academic_dishonesty.fabrication: Submission of falsified data, information, citations, or results
academic_dishonesty.unauthorized_ai: Unauthorized use of external aid/AI resulting in undue academic advantage
consequences: Grade penalty (minimum F in the course)
Possible suspension or expulsion for repeat offenses

levels.name: Warning
levels.description: Written reprimand for minor first-time offenses

levels.name: Suspension
levels.description: Temporary exclusion from classes and campus

source: Ateneo College Student Handbook Vol 2, 2025 Edition
